class aiowowapi.api.API(client_id: str, client_secret: str, client_region: APIRegion | str, *, max_parallel_requests: int | None = None, max_request_retries: int | None = None, request_retry_delay: int | None = None, request_debugging: bool | None = None)ÔÉÅ

async get_resource(hostname: str, api_endpoint: str, params: dict | None = None, headers: dict | None = None, auth: BasicAuth | None = None, method: str | None = 'GET') → dict | NoneÔÉÅ

Make an API request and return the response as a JSON dictionary

Parameters:

  • hostname (str) ‚Äì The hostname to make the request to

  • api_endpoint (str) ‚Äì The API endpoint following the regional hostname we wish to send a request to.

  • params (dict, optional) ‚Äì The additional arguments/parameters we need to send with the request, defaults to None

  • headers (dict, optional) ‚Äì Any header information to send with our request

  • auth (aiohttp.BasicAuth, optional) ‚Äì The aiohttp BasicAuth object to use for authentication, defaults to None

  • method (str, optional) ‚Äì The HTTP method to use for the request, defaults to ‚ÄúGET‚Äù

Raises:

  • RequestMethodException ‚Äì Raised when an invalid HTTP request method is selected.

  • RequestException ‚Äì Raised when we encounter an issue when making an aiohttp request.

Returns:

The response from the API as a JSON dictionary

Return type:

dict, none

requests (list) ‚Äì A list of API request coroutines
